required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Retropubic Single Incision Minisling Versus Tension Free Vaginal Tape for Management of Stress Urinary Incontinence
clinical_study.official_title: Retropubic Single Incision Minisling Versus Tension Free Vaginal Tape for Management of Stress Urinary Incontinence

brief_summary.textblock: Based on previous studies the single incision minisling is an easy less invasive procedure with fewer complications and cure rate similar to conventional midurethral slings in the treatment of female stress urinary incontinence. The aim of this study is to test the hypothesis that the single incision mini-sling placed in the "U" position is not inferior to TVT in this patient population.

primary_outcome.measure: objective cure rate of urinary incontinence at 12 months after surgery
primary_outcome.description: Objective cure is indicated by a negative stress test and the absence of any additional surgical or nonsurgical treatment for stress urinary incontinence

primary_outcome.measure: subjective cure rate of urinary incontinence at 12 months after surgery
primary_outcome.description: subjective cure is indicated by an Incontinence Severity Index score of 0 and the absence of any additional surgical or nonsurgical treatment for stress urinary incontinence

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of participants with short- term complications
secondary_outcome.description: short-term complications (less than 6 weeks): post-operative pain, urinary retention, denovo urgency and wound sepsis

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of participants with long-term complications
secondary_outcome.description: long-term complications: erosion, dyspareunia and recurrence

arm_group.description: patients in this arm will undergo single incision minisling
patients in this arm will undergo tension free vaginal tape

intervention.description: midline incision of the vagina at midurethral level dissection of the vagina from perivesical fascia insertion of the tape (polypropylene macropore mesh tape) in the retropubic direction with its end grasped with an artery forceps till level of perineal membrane closure of the vagina 2 sham incisions if the skin only will be made at suprapubic to maintain blindness posterior colpoperneorraphy will be carried out if needed

midline incision of the vagina at midurethral level dissection of the vagina from perivesical fascia insertion of the tape (polypropylene macropore mesh tape) with the applicators in the retropubic direction and 2 skin incision will be made supra pubic through which the applicators will be passed and removed and the tape will be cut at level just below the skin closure of the vagina posterior colpoperneorraphy will be carried out if needed

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Patients with urodynamic stress urinary incontinence, with or without pelvic organ prolapse
Exclusion Criteria:
- Patients with overactive bladder on urodynamic study.
- Patients with voiding dysfunction.
- Patients with intrinsic sphincteric deficiency.
- Patients with previous anti-incontinence surgery.
- Patients on anti-coagulant therapy.
- Immune-compromised patients (DM, patients on corticosteroids treatment).
- Refusal of surgery.
